event: On February 21, 1965, Malcolm X was assassinated in New York City.
Malcolm X was born May 19, 1925, in Omaha, Nebraska, the fourth of seven children of Grenada-born Louise Helen Little (née Langdon) and Georgia-born Earl Little.

In 1946, Malcolm X was arrested while picking up a stolen watch Malcolm X had left at a shop for repairs, and in February began serving a sentence of eight to ten years at Charlestown State Prison for larceny and breaking and entering.
Malcolm X showed scant interest at first, but after his brother Reginald wrote in 1948, "Malcolm X, don't eat any more pork and don't smoke any more cigarettes.
In June 1953, Malcolm X was named assistant minister of the Nation's's Temple Number One in Detroit.

Later that year Malcolm X established Boston's Temple Number 11; in March 1954, Malcolm X expanded Temple Number 12 in Philadelphia; and two months later Malcolm X was selected to lead Temple Number 7 in Harlem, where he rapidly expanded its membershipTemple Number 7 in Harlem, where he rapidly expanded its membership's

Malcolm X's comments on issues and events were being widely reported in print, on radio, and on television, and Malcolm X was featured in a 1959 New York City television broadcast about the Nation of Islam, The Hate That Hate Produced.
In September 1960, at the United Nations General Assembly in New York City, Malcolm X was invited to the official functions of several African nations.
In 1961, Malcolm X spoke at a NOI rally alongside George Lincoln Rockwell, the head of the American Nazi Party.

event: Malcolm X was interviewed on the subjects of segregation and the Nation of Islam by Robert Penn Warren for Robert Penn Warren's 1965 book Who Speaks for the Negro?
category1: Activity after leaving Nation of Islam

event: Throughout 1964, as Malcolm X's conflict with the Nation of Islam intensified, Malcolm X was repeatedly threatened.
category1: Death threats and intimidation from Nation of Islam

event: On February 21, 1965, Malcolm X was preparing to address the OAAU in Manhattan's Audubon Ballroom when someone in the 400-person audience yelled,"Nigger! Get your hand outta someone in the 400-person audience's pocket!"As
